label: ABC2_hR4_160_a_a_2a-002
title: Grimaldiite ($\alpha$-CrOOH) Structure
comments:
CrOOH is found naturally in three forms. They are usually found together with Cr$_{2}$O$_{3}$ in a mineral known as merumite (Milton, 1976): \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_hR4_160_a_a_2a-002}{Grimaldiite, rhombohedral $\alpha$-CrOOH} (this structure), \item \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_oP8_31_a_a_2a-001}{Guyanaite, orthorhombic $\beta$-CrOOH}, and \item Bracewellite, orthorhombic $\gamma$-CrOOH is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C2_oC20_63_c_f_2c-001}{Lepidocrocite ($\gamma$-FeOOH, $E0_{4}$)} structure. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 We use the $R3m$ data from Table IIIa (Christensen,1977), which locates the hydrogen atoms. 
  Space group $R3m$ \#160 does not specify the origin of the $z$-axis.  Here we choose $z_{I} = 0$ for the position of the chromium atom. 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_hR4_160_a_a_2a-002}{$\alpha$-CrOOH} and \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_hR4_160_a_a_2a-003}{CrCuS$_{2}$} have the AFLOW prototype label, ABC2\_hR4\_160\_a\_a\_2a. They are generated by the same symmetry operations with different sets of parameters ({\tt --params}) specified in their corresponding CIF files. 
 Hexagonal settings of this structure can be obtained with the option {\tt --hex}.
